result.execSummary:
The defendant Marion D. McNamer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling ordered by the agent.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.  The Court has imposed one set of costs only in this case.

Credit in the event of revocation:  0 days.

Defendant to submit to DNA sampling at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before signing up for probation.

(Defendant is on a felony diversion agreement with the DA for Count 4.)

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

60 days conditional jail time, consecutive to the straight jail sentence in 16CF13.  Jail in 14CF75 is without good time.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete all programs ordered by the agent.

No costs imposed by the Court in this matter.

RCSD - Disposition of Warrant or Commitment (Time Served)

Defendant Marion D. McNamer in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  16CF13 and 14CF75 called together, both for status. Counsel inform the Court the parties have reached an agreement for resolution whereby def will plead to count 2, possession of controlled substance, without the repeater, in 16CF13; additionally, her DPA will be revoked in 14CF75 on count 4, maintaining drug trafficking place, def having previously pled and been found guilty of that offense.

State moves for amendment to delete the enhancer on count 2 in 16CF13.  Court allows the amendment.

To count 2 of 16CF13, as now amended, Def pleads guilty.  Court's colloquy on plea.

16CF13 - 30 days jail with good time and huber. Costs.  Jail stayed until on or before July 5, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.  0 days credit.
14CF75 - sentence on count 4 - withheld for 3 years probation with 60 days conditional time, consecutive to 16CF13 jail, without good time. Conditions:  attend, pay for, and succ. complete all programs ordered by agent.  No costs ordered in this case.

DA notes that def's probation has NOT been revoked on counts 1-3 in 14CF75.
Status conference on June 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Marion D. McNamer in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Marion D. McNamer in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt.  Counsel inform the Court that they are working towards resolution of these matters; asks for status.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
State
Motion hearing on May 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Marion D. McNamer in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA requests this matter be setover.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing at 03-10-2016 01:15 pm

Defendant Marion D. McNamer in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. 16CF13/adjourned initial and 14CF75/motion hrg on State's motion to revoke DPA. Court directs def to contact SPD re eligibility. Matters adj. to 3/10 at 1:15.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
to vacate the Diversion Agreement

Defendant Marion D. McNamer in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Counsel advise the Court that the parties have reached a plea agreement.  Count 4 is a felony.  Def waives her right to the prelim for that count.  Court's colloquy re prelim waiver.

State files information which calls for amendment of Counts 1, 2, and 3, originally charged as felonies, to Class A misdemeanors of "possession of controlled substance."  Court allows the amendment.

Def pleads guilty to the three misdemeanor counts and the one felony count.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Judgment ordered for Counts 1, 2, and 3.  

Counsel address the Court.

Counts 1-3 - sentence withheld for probation of 2 years.  Conditions:  AODA/follow through.  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling ordered by agent.  Costs.  

Defense asks for 1 set of costs based on indigency of def.  Court orders one set of costs.

Count 4 - Court approves diversion agreement for term of 3 years.

Credit in the event of revocation:  0 days.

Def to submit to DNA sampling at RCSD before signing up for probation.
Status conference at 06-24-2015 10:00 am

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Marion D. McNamer. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Marion D. McNamer not in court.  At 10:05, DA requests warrant.  So ordered.  

Matter recalled at 11:15.  Def present.  Warrant quashed.  Status set for June 24 at 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Marion D. McNamer in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A. McDougal appeared by phone means for Defendant Marion D. McNamer. McDougal requested that this hearing be adjourned.  She has not had an opportunity to review the complaint.  Matter adjourned to 12-8-2014 1:30.
